events.message: Customer reported a vehicle collision that resulted in significant damage to the front bumper and hood. The accident occurred on the morning of April 30th.
The submitted claim was reviewed and categorized under 'Auto Accident' due to keywords regarding car damage and collision details.
An insurance agent has been assigned to handle the automobile collision claim for further processing and customer assistance.
Acknowledgement sent confirming the receipt of the auto accident claim and information on next procedural steps was provided to the customer.
Request sent to customer for submission of police report, vehicle repair estimates, and photographs of the collision damage.
Customer provided all requested documents including police report and detailed repair cost estimates for the damaged vehicle.
Investigation into the auto collision claim has begun, with claims adjusters reviewing submitted evidence and vehicle condition.
Investigation concluded confirming the accident details and validating the customer's extent of vehicle damage for claim processing.
A settlement offer was prepared based on the repair costs and coverage terms and sent to the customer for review.
Customer responded positively to the proposed settlement amount and expressed satisfaction with the timely handling of the claim.
Claim officially approved by insurance management for the agreed settlement amount based on investigation findings.
Payment for the approved claim amount was issued to the customerâ€™s bank account to cover the car repair expenses.
The auto accident claim case has been successfully closed following payment disbursement and positive customer feedback.
All claim documents and correspondence have been archived for record keeping in accordance with company policies.
